title: Grid connection of energy systems via inverters Part 1: Installation requirements
transition_period: 6 months after publication for standard application, 18 months for soft limit export control function (Clause 3.4.8.3)

scope.primary: Safety and installation requirements for inverter energy systems (IES) intended for injection of electric power through electrical installation to the grid
scope.system_focus: Distributed energy resources when connecting to the grid
scope.safety_objective: Ensure overall safe operation of installation and interaction with broader grid

standards_series.integration: Part 1 must be read in conjunction with Part 2

mandatory_compliance_standards.wiring_rules: AS/NZS 3000 Electrical installations (Australian/New Zealand Wiring Rules)
mandatory_compliance_standards.pv_arrays: AS/NZS 5033 Installation and safety requirements for photovoltaic (PV) arrays (where applicable)
mandatory_compliance_standards.inverter_safety: IEC 62109-2 Safety of power converters for use in photovoltaic power systems Part 2: Particular requirements for inverters (for grid-connected PV systems)

regulatory_integration.distributor_rules: Must be read in conjunction with regulations, service and installation rules of electricity distributor approving the connection
regulatory_integration.authority_approval: Electricity distributor approval required for grid connection

technical_evolution.revision_scope: Extensive revision to cater for changes in industry
technical_evolution.inverter_requirements: Both AS/NZS 4777.1 and AS/NZS 5033 now require inverters complying with IEC 62109-2
technical_evolution.other_energy_sources: Revised to accommodate consideration of other energy sources where relevant standards may not be available

transitional_provisions.standard_transition: Either AS/NZS 4777.1:2016 or AS 4777.1—2005 may be utilized during 6-month period after publication
transitional_provisions.part2_transition: During transitional period, either inverter complying with AS/NZS 4777.2:2015 or inverter complying with both AS 4777.2—2005 and AS 4777.3—2005 may be used
transitional_provisions.export_control: Soft limit export control function provisions apply 18 months after publication
transitional_provisions.regulator_adoption: Transitional periods expected to be adopted by relevant regulators

system_scope.inverter_energy_systems: Systems intended for electric power injection through electrical installation to grid
system_scope.distributed_energy_resources: IES classified as distributed energy resources when connecting to grid
system_scope.grid_interaction: Focus on safe operation and interaction with broader grid infrastructure

safety_requirements.installation_safety: Comprehensive safety requirements for inverter energy system installations
safety_requirements.grid_safety: Safe interaction with broader electrical grid
safety_requirements.system_safety: Overall safe operation of complete installation

technical_committees.joint_committee: EL-042, Renewable Energy Power Supply Systems and Equipment
technical_committees.expertise_base: Requirements developed by group of utility, photovoltaic, renewable energy, battery, inverter and industry experts

industry_accommodation.multiple_modes: Accommodates multiple mode inverter energy systems
industry_accommodation.smart_grid: Commencement of smart grid enabling capabilities
industry_accommodation.energy_diversity: Limited provisions for other energy source technologies until specific standards developed

compliance_framework.mandatory_requirements: Statements in mandatory terms in notes to figures are requirements of this Standard
compliance_framework.distributor_coordination: Must coordinate with electricity distributor regulations and installation rules
compliance_framework.safety_integration: Integrates with AS/NZS 3000 wiring rules and AS/NZS 5033 PV requirements

grid_connection_context.power_injection: Covers systems that inject electric power to grid through electrical installation
grid_connection_context.distributed_resources: Treats grid-connected energy systems as distributed energy resources
grid_connection_context.system_integration: Ensures safe integration of energy systems with existing grid infrastructure

technical_specifications.inverter_compliance: Requires IEC 62109-2 compliant inverters for grid-connected PV systems
technical_specifications.safety_standards: Integrates multiple safety standards for comprehensive grid connection safety
technical_specifications.installation_requirements: Specific installation requirements for grid-connected energy systems
